       Education and Training      Bachelor of Science  ,   Computer Science/ Information Technology   May 2013     Limestone College   －   City  ,   State     Computer Science/ Information Technology       Bachelor of Science  ,   Business Administration   Dec. 2011     Limestone College   －   City  ,   State     Business Administration       Bachelor of Science  ,   Computer Science Software/Programming   Dec. 2011     Limestone College   －   City  ,   State     Computer Science Software/Programming       Master's degree Information Technology(MIT)      University of Virginia Tech          Present                Skills    API, Billing system, C, C++, Hardware, Database, Dns, e-commerce, Eclipse, EJB, XMl, Ftp, hard drives, Html, Hubs, Ide, Information Technology, Java, JSP, JavaScript, memory, Access, Microsoft Access, C#, Excel, Office, Outlook, PowerPoint, Microsoft Visio Professional, Windows 7, Windows 8, Microsoft Windows XP, MS Word, MySQL, Network, Networks, object-oriented design, Oracle, Peripherals, coding, programming, RAID, Router, Servers, Servlet, Microsoft SQL Server, SQL Server, cisco switches, system design, Tcp/Ip, Team work, user documentation, Uml, Vpn, Microsoft Visual Basic, Visual Studio, website, written, Xhtml
story:
Let me transform this resume into a coherent story:

Meet a versatile technology professional whose journey in the tech world has been both diverse and progressive. Starting from humble beginnings as a Machinist and CNC Programmer from 2001 to 2009, they mastered the art of programming industrial machines for plumbing equipment, laying a foundation for their future in technology.

Driven by ambition and a thirst for knowledge, they pursued multiple degrees at Limestone College, earning not one but three Bachelor of Science degrees - in Business Administration, Computer Science Software/Programming (both completed in 2011), and Computer Science/Information Technology (2013). Currently, they're furthering their education with a Master's in Information Technology at Virginia Tech.

Their career took a significant turn when they became a Database Administrator in December 2009. For over seven years, they worked with various database management systems, helping organizations modernize their data infrastructure by migrating information from legacy systems to new platforms.

From March 2014 to May 2017, they elevated their career to a Consultant role, where they showcased their expertise in object-oriented design and programming. During this time, they developed Java-based billing systems and designed database systems for e-commerce websites using EJB platform. Their responsibilities included creating comprehensive test plans, documentation, and troubleshooting hardware issues, particularly with fault-tolerant hard drives.

Their technical arsenal is impressive, spanning multiple programming languages (Java, C++, C#, JavaScript), database technologies (MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server), and various development tools and platforms. They're equally comfortable working with Microsoft Office Suite, networking technologies, and web development tools.

What makes them stand out is not just their technical prowess, but their ability to communicate effectively and solve complex problems. They excel at identifying and resolving technical issues while maintaining strong relationships with end-users through their help desk support experience.

This is the story of a professional who evolved from programming machines to programming solutions, continuously adapting and growing in the ever-changing landscape of information technology.
